Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged complicity in MQM's crimes against humanity
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Personal and knowing participation, shared common purpose, knowledge of atrocities
Crimes.Institutional_Action: Immigration and Refugee Board dismissed refugee claim
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Active membership, leadership roles, fundraising (bhatta collection)
Crimes.Personal_Data_Implicated: Membership duration, leadership role, fundraising activities
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Credibility of denial assessed against context and involvement
Crimes.Role_of_Person: Active member and leader within MQM
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Complicity requires personal and knowing participation
Crimes.Protection_Claim: Refugee protection under the Refugee Convention
Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: Not applicable – exclusion due to personal conduct
Crimes.Credibility: Denied knowledge of atrocities; deemed unbelievable
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Article 1F(a) exclusion for complicity in crimes against humanity
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Civilians subjected to violence by MQM

Crimes.Sub_Crime_Type: Murder as part of crimes against humanity
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: No direct conviction, but organizational affiliation
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High (involvement in murder as crime against humanity)
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Credible evidence of MQM’s pattern of violence
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Mr. Ali’s denial not credible given role and context
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Risk of being complicit in ongoing violence
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Civilians opposed to or targeted by MQM
Crimes.Governing_Law: International customary law, domestic immigration law
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged complicity in MQM's torture practices
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Personal and knowing participation in torture as part of crimes against humanity
Crimes.Institutional_Action: Immigration and Refugee Board dismissed refugee claim
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Active membership, leadership roles, fundraising (bhatta collection)
Crimes.Personal_Data_Implicated: Membership duration, leadership role, fundraising activities
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Credibility of denial assessed against context and involvement
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Complicity in torture as crime against humanity
Crimes.Role_of_Person: Active member and leader within MQM
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Complicity requires personal and knowing participation
Crimes.Protection_Claim: Refugee protection under the Refugee Convention
Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: Not applicable – exclusion due to personal conduct
Crimes.Credibility: Denied knowledge of torture; deemed unbelievable
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Article 1F(a) exclusion for complicity in crimes against humanity including torture
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Civilians subjected to torture by MQM

Crimes.Sub_Crime_Type: Extortion (bhatta collection) as part of organized violence
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Use of violence or threat of violence to extract funds
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: No direct conviction, but organizational affiliation
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High (systematic extortion linked to terrorism and violence)
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Credible evidence of MQM’s extortion practices
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Mr. Ali’s denial not credible given role in fundraising
Crimes.Governing_Law: International customary law, domestic immigration law
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
